feed.title: Trend Science and Research
feed.subtitle: RSS feed based on RSS and LLM.

entry.title: Genetic Heatwaves: Exploring Maize's ATL Family during High-Temperature Stress
entry.summary:
In the world of scientific research, several interesting developments have taken place. In the field of genetics, a study published in Genes journal titled "Genome-Wide Identification and Functional Analysis of the Genes of the ATL Family in Maize during High-Temperature Stress in Maize" explores the impact of high-temperature stress on maize genes. This research sheds light on the response of maize to environmental stressors.

Another study published in Applied Sciences journal titled "Application of Explosive Equivalency Approach in Blast-Induced Seismic Effect Prediction Using EXPLO5 Thermochemical Code" focuses on predicting blast-induced seismic effects. By utilizing the EXPLO5 Thermochemical Code, researchers aim to enhance the understanding and prediction of the seismic impact caused by explosions.

In the realm of machine learning and fault diagnosis, Machines journal presents a study titled "Support Vector Machine-Based Fault Diagnosis under Data Imbalance with Application to High-Speed Train Electric Traction Systems." This research utilizes support vector machines to diagnose faults in high-speed train electric traction systems, addressing the challenge of data imbalance.

Sensors journal features a study titled "Research on Corn Leaf and Stalk Recognition and Ranging Technology Based on LiDAR and Camera Fusion." This research explores the fusion of LiDAR and camera technology for the recognition and ranging of corn leaf and stalk. Such advancements can contribute to precision agriculture and crop management.

Toxics journal presents a study titled "Unveiling the Mysteries of Contrast-Induced Acute Kidney Injury: New Horizons in Pathogenesis and Prevention." This research delves into the pathogenesis and prevention of contrast-induced acute kidney injury, shedding light on new possibilities for understanding and managing this condition.

In the field of sustainability, a systematic review titled "Multi-Criteria Decision Analysis for Sustainable Oil and Gas Infrastructure Decommissioning: A Systematic Review of Criteria Involved in the Process" is published in Sustainability journal. This review examines the criteria involved in the process of sustainable oil and gas infrastructure decommissioning, providing insights for decision-making in this domain.

Symmetry journal introduces new fixed point theorems in a study titled "New Fixed Point Theorems for Generalized Meirâ€“Keeler Type Nonlinear Mappings with Applications to Fixed Point Theory." These theorems have applications in fixed point theory and contribute to the understanding of nonlinear mappings.

In the realm of healthcare, a study published in Vaccines journal titled "Effect of Childhood Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccination on Invasive Disease Serotypes in Serbia" investigates the impact of childhood pneumococcal conjugate vaccination on invasive disease serotypes in Serbia. This research highlights the effectiveness of vaccination in preventing certain diseases.

JCM journal presents a study titled "Self-Efficacy and Perceived Stress in Women Experiencing Preterm Birth." This research explores the relationship between self-efficacy and perceived stress in women who have experienced preterm birth, providing valuable insights into the psychological aspects of this experience.

Lastly, Energies journal features a study titled "Size-Dispersed Calcium Phosphate-Based Paints for Sustainable, Durable Cool Roof Applications." This research focuses on the development of size-dispersed calcium phosphate-based paints for cool roof applications, aiming to enhance sustainability and durability in the construction industry.

In terms of new tools, products, or projects, the mentioned articles do not explicitly mention any. However, it is important to note that these studies contribute to the overall advancement of knowledge and understanding in their respective fields, which can potentially lead to the development of new tools, products, or projects in the future.
